StoredProcedureSqlServerv2k5.name: [SaveSchool]
StoredProcedureSqlServerv2k5.body:
( @SchoolId uniqueiden..er, @SchoolType char(2), @AddrStreet1 varchar(25), @AddrStreet2 varchar(25), @AddrCity varchar(15), @AddrState varchar(25), @AddrCounty varchar(25), @AddrCountry varchar(25), @AddrZip varchar(5), @SchoolPhone varchar(12), @SchoolName varchar(100) ) AS BEGIN
BEGIN TRANSACTION
IF EXISTS(SELECT SchoolId FROM [ACP].School WHERE [SchoolId] = @SchoolId) BEGIN UPDATE [ACP].[School] SET [SchoolType] = @SchoolType, [AddrStreet1] = @AddrStreet1, [AddrStreet2] = @AddrStreet2, [AddrCity] = @AddrCity, [AddrState] = @AddrState, [AddrCounty] = @AddrCounty, [AddrCountry] = @AddrCountry, [AddrZip] = @AddrZip, [SchoolPhone] = @SchoolPhone, [SchoolName] = @SchoolName WHERE [SchoolId] = @SchoolId END ELSE BEGIN INSERT INTO [ACP].[School] ( [SchoolId], [SchoolType], [AddrStreet1], [AddrStreet2], [AddrCity], [AddrState], [AddrCounty], [AddrCountry], [AddrZip], [SchoolPhone], [SchoolName] ) VALUES ( @SchoolId, @SchoolType, @AddrStreet1, @AddrStreet2, @AddrCity, @AddrState, @AddrCounty, @AddrCountry, @AddrZip, @SchoolPhone, @SchoolName )
END
-- Rollback the transac.on if there were any errors IF @@ERROR <> 0 BEGIN -- Rollback the transac.on ROLLBACK TRANSACTION
-- Raise an error and return RAISERROR ('Error occurred while performing the change.', 16, 1) RETURN END
-- Rollback the transac.on if the number of rows changed does not meet our expecta.on... IF @@ROWCOUNT > 1 BEGIN -- Rollback the transac.on ROLLBACK TRANSACTION
-- Raise an error and return RAISERROR ('An unexpected number of rows were changed.', 16, 1) RETURN END
-- If we reach this point, the commands completed successfully. COMMIT TRANSACTION END
